question: Find the relative extrema of the function $f:{\mathbb R}^2\rightarrow {\mathbb R}$ given by $f(x,y)=3xy^2-x^3-15x-36y+9$.
answer1: The function $f$ has no extrema points.
answer3: M$(2,3)$ is a minimizer and N$(-2,-3)$ is a maximizer for function $f$.
answer4: M$(2,3)$ is a maximizer and N$(-2,-3)$ is a minimizer for function $f$.

question: Indicate which of the following applications is linear.
Consider in the three-dimensional cartesian system the plane of equation $\pi: 2x-3y+z-1=0$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(-1, -1, 0)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(-4, 6, -2)$.
answer2: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, 3, 1)$.
answer3: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 1)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.
answer4: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, -1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\

\end{array}$

G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist

answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{2}\rightarrow \mathbb{R},$ $%
f(x,y)=e^{ax^{2}+by^{2}}$. It satisfies the equations:
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),
\dfrac{\partial^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abxyf(x,y).$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2af(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abxyf(x,y).$
answer3:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4abf(x,y).$
answer4:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}\left( x,y\right) =2axf(x,y),\dfrac{\partial
^{2}f}{\partial x^{2}}\left( x,y\right) =\left( 2a+4a^{2}x^{2}\right) f(x,y),%
\dfrac{\partial ^{2}f}{\partial x\partial y}(x,y)=4bxyf(x,y).$

Consider the function $f(x,y)=\dfrac{x-y^{4}}{x^{3}-y^{4}}$, where $y^{4} \neq x^{3}$.

Study the limits
$\lim\limits_{x\rightarrow 1}\Big [\lim\limits_{y\rightarrow 1}f(x,y)\Big]$, $\lim\limits_{y\rightarrow 1}\Big [\lim\limits_{x\rightarrow 1}f(x,y)\Big]$ and $\lim\limits_{ (x,y)\rightarrow (1,1)}f(x,y).$
answer1:
$\lim\limits_{x\rightarrow 1}\Big [\lim\limits_{y\rightarrow 1}f(x,y)\Big]=\frac{1}{3}$, $\lim\limits_{y\rightarrow 1}\Big [\lim\limits_{x\rightarrow 1}f(x,y)\Big]=1$, but the limit
$\lim\limits_{ (x,y)\rightarrow (1,1)}f(x,y)$ does not exist.
answer2:
$\lim\limits_{x\rightarrow 1}\Big [\lim\limits_{y\rightarrow 1}f(x,y)\Big]=\lim\limits_{y\rightarrow 1}\Big [\lim\limits_{x\rightarrow 1}f(x,y)\Big]=1$, but the limit
$\lim\limits_{ (x,y)\rightarrow (1,1)}f(x,y)$ does not exist.

question: What is the best point estimate of the population mean?

answer2: The most frequently occurring wind speed in the sample was $7 m/s$.
answer3: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was equal to $7 m/s$.
answer4: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $10 m/s$.

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

The WorldLight Company produces two light fixtures (products $1$ and $2$) that require both metal frame parts and electrical components. Management wants to determine how many units of each product to produce so as to maximize profit. For each unit of product $1$, $1$ unit of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. For each unit of product $2$, $3$ units of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. The company has $200$ units of frame parts and $300$ units of electrical components. 

Each unit of product $1$ gives a profit of $1?$, and each unit of product $2$, up to $60$ units, gives a profit of $2?$. Any excess over	$60$ units of product $2$ brings no profit, so such excess has been ruled out.
	
In this situation, what are the decision variables to formalize the Linear Programming (LP) model that allows planning the company's activity?
answer1: $x_{i}$ the number of units of product $i$ produced ($i=1$, for product $A$ and $i=2$, for product $B$).
answer2: $x$ the number of units of product $1$ and $2$ produced.
answer3: $x_{1}$ is the number of units of product $1$ produced.
answer4: $x_{2}$ is the number of units of product $2$ produced.

Find the integral curve which satisfies the equation $tx'-x=-2t^2x^2$ with initial condition $x(1)=1$.
answer1: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $x(2t^3+1)-3t=0$.
answer2: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $x(2t^3+3)-t=0$.
answer3: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $\frac{x}{2t^3+1}-3t=0$.
answer4: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $x=\frac{2t^3+1}{3t}$.

$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & - & 3t & = & 1 \\ 
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 2 \\ 
x &- &3y &+ &z &- &2t &= &-1 \\
  &   &      &     &z &- &t &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(5,\,1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(5+20y,\,y,\,-10-13y,\,8+15y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Four workers ($W_1$, $W_2$, $W_3$ and $W_4$) should be selected to perform three different tasks ($T_1$, $T_2$ and $T_3$), for which they are unequally prepared. Based on the qualifications and previous experience, it was possible to construct the following table which indicates, for each worker $j$, the operation time in each task  $i$ (in weeks):

\[
\begin{array}{l|cccc|}
& W_1 & W_2 & W_3 & W_4\\
\hline
T_1 & 2 & 6 & 7 & 4 \\
T_2 & 9 & 8 & 4 & 2 \\
T_3 & 2 & 7 & 5 & 7 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]	

What workers should be selected to carry out the tasks, in order to minimize the total time spent by them?

Find the directional derivative of the function $f:\mathbb{R}^{3}\rightarrow\mathbb{R},\ \ f(x,y,z)=xy^{2}-4x^{2}y+z^{2}$ at the point $M(1,-1,2)$ in the direction $\overrightarrow{s}$, where $\overrightarrow{s}$ is the unit vector of $\overrightarrow{v}=6\overrightarrow{i}+2\overrightarrow{j}+3\overrightarrow{k}.$
Differentiate $\displaystyle{y=3e^x-2^x+4x^2}$.

Solve for $x$:

$\frac{x}{3} +2=6x$

Consider a function $f:\mathbb{R}->\mathbb{R}$ for which the only values known are

$$\begin{array}{|c|r|r|r|r|}
\hline
x & -2 & -1 & 0 & 1 \\
\hline
f(x) & 1 &	2 & 5 & A \\
\hline
\end{array}$$

Knowing that the values of $f$ belong to a polynomial of degree $2$, determine the value of $A$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & + & 2z & = & a \\
x & + & 2y & + & z & = & b \\
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
4x & + & 3y & + & 4z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has solutions if and only if $a=-2$ and $b=5$. 
In this case, there is an infinite number of solution, which are of the form $\left(x,\,4,\,-3-x\right)$ for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer2:
The system has solutions if and only if $a \neq \frac{7}{4}$ and $b \neq \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the solutions are of the form $\left(\frac{3}{4}a-z,\,\frac{1}{4}b,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
The system has solutions if and only if $a = \frac{7}{4}$ and $b = \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the unique solution is $\left(\frac{3}{4},\,\frac{1}{4},\,0\right)$.
